cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 255 miles SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move WNW across the northwest Caribbean, cross or skirt the Yucatan Channel late Monday, then turn north across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the central U.S. Gulf Coast mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast (likely Louisiana or Mississippi coastline)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Pinar del Rio province, western Cuba under Tropical Storm Watch
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from Louisiana to Alabama expected to receive direct impacts; Florida Keys and western Cuba under potential tropical-storm impacts
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late Thursday with gusts generally below tropical-storm force
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the South Carolina coast based on current track
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible as remnants pass inland west of the port late Thursday–Friday
